sentences.english: I've just been to the lavatory.
sentences.chinese: 我剛去過盥洗室梳洗了一番。

sentences.english: He laid that case aside then he went to the lavatory to wash his face.
sentences.chinese: 他把案件擱置一邊然後去盥洗室洗臉。

sentences.english: The cloakroom where you can hang your coat or leave your bags is just behind us here.
sentences.chinese: 盥洗室可以掛包或者把包放在我們我們這。

sentences.english: Myrtle haunts a girls' bathroom on the second floor.
sentences.chinese: 桃金娘經常出沒在二樓的一間女盥洗室。

sentences.english: It is leaking, so the washroom floor is full of water now.
sentences.chinese: 管子漏水，所以盥洗室的地上滿都是水。

sentences.english: Bathrooms should be designed around people.
sentences.chinese: 盥洗室的設計應以人爲本。

sentences.english: Air Conditioning, Ensuite Bathroom, Hair Dryer, Satellite TV, Telephone.
sentences.chinese: 吹風機，房間內帶盥洗室，電話，空調機。

sentences.english: I remembered the books on Henrys washstand and asked her if she would read me a story.
sentences.chinese: 我想起亨利盥洗架上的書，就問她能否給我讀個故事。

sentences.english: B:I've just been to the lavatory.
sentences.chinese: 我剛去過盥洗室梳洗了一番。

sentences.english: She tarted up in the Ladies.
sentences.chinese: 她在女盥洗室裏濃妝豔抹了一番。

sentences.english: There is all the same a distance between the bedroom and the wash room (cabinet de toilette).
sentences.chinese: 在臥房跟盥洗浴室之間，仍然有一段距離。

sentences.english: We freshened up before going to the party.
sentences.chinese: 我們盥洗打扮了一番再去參加舞會。

sentences.english: There are washrooms in every carriage of the train for passengers to wash their faces and rinse their mouths.
sentences.chinese: 火車上的盥洗室設在每節車廂之間，供旅客洗漱使用。

sentences.english: Taking a shower really turns the bathroom into a swimming pool.
sentences.chinese: 淋浴一次，真的能把盥洗間變成浴池。

sentences.english: If you die down there, you're welcome to share my toilet.
sentences.chinese: 如果你在下面死了，歡迎你來與我分享這個盥洗室。

sentences.english: And shopkeepers let her use their telephones and bathrooms.
sentences.chinese: 店主讓她使用自己的電話和盥洗室。

definition: to rinse the mouth and wash the face
to make oneself presentable/to freshen up
to change clothes/to go to the toilet (euphemism)
to wash one's hands/(fig.) to go to the toilet
to ladle water/to scoop up water
please take off your coat (honorific)/loose-fitting garment
same as 整裝|整装/to get ready (for a journey)
